definitions.translation: 爆发；（疾病、战争、暴力等的）突然发生
definitions.usage_note: 可数名词，常与 of 连用（outbreak of sth）。多指疾病、疫情、战争、暴力、骚乱等的突然爆发。与 eruption、flare-up 相比，outbreak 更常用于疾病或社会动荡。

sentences.en: There was an outbreak of flu in the school.
The outbreak of war in 1914 changed the course of history.
sentences.zh: 1914 年战争的爆发改变了历史进程。

sentences.en: Health officials are trying to contain the outbreak before it spreads to other regions.
sentences.zh: 卫生官员正努力在疫情扩散到其他地区之前将其控制住。

sentences.en: The outbreak of war caught many by surprise.
sentences.zh: 战争的爆发令许多人措手不及。

sentences.en: The outbreak of disease was traced to contaminated water.
sentences.zh: 疾病爆发被追溯到水源污染。

phrases.explain: 指某次爆发事件进行中

sentences.en: Many hospitals were overwhelmed in the outbreak.
sentences.zh: 爆发期间许多医院不堪重负。

eruption.diffs: eruption 更常用于火山、冲突的突然爆发；outbreak 更常用于疾病、疫情。

flare-up.diffs: flare-up 可指疾病或冲突的突然加剧，语气稍口语；outbreak 更正式、常用于公共卫生语境。

etymology.origin: 来自动词短语 break out（爆发、突然发生），out 与 break 组合成名词。
etymology.history: 由 break out 逆构为名词 outbreak，多指疾病、冲突等的突然发生。

break out.rule: outbreak 的名词形式来源于该短语动词

sentences.en: Fighting broke out between the two groups.

common_mistakes.correct: outbreak of disease / an outbreak of the disease
common_mistakes.explain: 泛指时用 outbreak of disease；特指某次爆发时用 an outbreak of the disease，注意冠词。

mnemonics.content: out（出）+ break（打破）→ 打破界限冲出来 → 爆发。联想：疫情 outbreak 像打破牢笼一样突然扩散。
